page.title: 12CHANGES IN NATURAL HABITATS
page.content: Man has changed the natural habitats over the centuries and is still changing them.The first major change in this area was when the oak woods were cut down in the 17th century. Another major change came when the level of Lough Neagh was controlled to prevent flooding. Effluent entering the lough is affecting the habitat.Farmers remove hedges, drain land, add artificial fertilisers and spray vegetables.This too affects the environment. Land reclamation is restricting areas available to wildlife. Various official bodies are monitoring these changes e.g THE PUBLIC HEALTH AUTHORITIES,THE DEPARTMENT OF INDUSTRIAL SCIENCE,THE FISHERIES CONSERVANCY BOARD and THE ROYAL SOCIETY FOR THE PROTECTION OF BIRDS.
